title: Sarah's Vineyard 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This young wine offers fresh raspberry and pomegranate scents on the lively, simple nose, with dashes of anise and wet slate. Those bright red fruit flavors show on the palate, too, seasoned with thyme and bay leaf and finishing clean.

title: Sauvion 2014 Château du Cléray Vallet  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This is a fine creamy wine, rich in white fruits with just a hint of citrus. The aging has given it concentration and depth, spice and a strong mineral character. Drink now.

title: Symington Family Estates 2015 Vale do Bomfim Red (Douro)
description: Produced from vines used to supply grapes for Dow's, a Symington Port, this is an easy open wine with attractive acidity as well as red-berry fruits. It has a fresh character that gives the wine its lift and fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Nodland 2013 Bad Attitude Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Quite light in color, this wine offers aromas of cherry, berry and baking spice. The palate is lighter styled, full of tart cranberry and cherry flavors, along with kisses of vanilla threaded throughout. It doesn't quite stand up on its own but does show a pretty sense of balance.

title: Nomadica 2016 Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This pale pink blend of 67% Grenache and 33% Cabernet Franc in a can taps the winemaking talents of Josh Klapper and original art from Sharon Ryder out of Joshua Tree. It offers apricot blossom and Pixie tangerine scents on the accessible if sweet nose. On the palate, expect orange and sliced lemon notes, with bolder red pear flavors and zippy acidity.

title: William Church 2014 Bishop's Blend Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This blend holds 47% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Syrah, 12% Merlot, 12% Petit Verdot, 7% Cabernet Franc and 3% Malbec. Aromas convey barrel spice, dried flower, herb, blue fruit, anise and cherry. The palate shows an elegant mix of dark-fruit flavors, with a touch of grittiness from the tannins.

title: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2016 Roussanne (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: It's rare to see an offering of this variety in Washington. This one comes from Lonesome Springs Vineyard. Aromas are initially so light you need to strain to get at them, with notes of lemon zest and herb. The palate is medium bodied, with stone-fruit flavors that provide appeal.

title: Garage Wine Co. 2014 Lot #62 La Higuera Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)
description: Ripe aromas of raisin and prune include notes of spice cake, vanilla and toast. This has a heavy rough palate, driven by skins-based tannins. Flavors of vanilla, baked black fruits and oak show notes of maple, brown sugar and raisin on a bold churning finish that's weighted down by pulling tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Grindstone 2013 Cortina Red (California)
description: Mouth-filling and firm in texture, this medium-bodied wine has plenty of black cherry, prune and spicy chocolate aromas and flavors. Blended from Cabernet Sauvgnon, Petite Verdot and Syrah, it has an appropriately tannic texture that melts on the finish and echoes the chocolate and spice notes.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Duas Castas Roupeiro-Viosinho White (Alentejano)
description: The two grapes here are more commonly found in the Douro. Here in the south of Portugal, they give a softer character—less mineral more ripe apple and pear fruitiness. The aftertaste does keep the delicious wine bright and lively.

title: Lacheteau 2016 Château de Montguéret  (Rosé d'Anjou)
description: This is a ripe fruity wine that shows the potential quality of this often-abused style. It is sweet but it has a fine texture and crisp acidity to balance that simple sweetness. The fine fruitiness and crisp aftertaste make it ready to drink now.

title: Hubert Meyer 2016 Riesling (Alsace)
description: A touch of yeast still clings to the zesty grapefruit aromas on the nose. The palate is light and has similar freshness, as well as a touch of tropicality, with the slightest hint of mango. The finish is dry and fresh.

title: I Campi 2015 Campo Vulcano  (Soave Classico)
description: White spring flower, beeswax and orchard fruit aromas take center stage while the round, ripe palate evokes yellow apple, candied lemon drop and a hint of fennel seed. A saline-like mineral note energizes the finish.

title: Kirkland Signature 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Made from 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% other Bordeaux varieties, this wine offers simple dark cherry fruit and chewy tannins, the oak firm and supportive, with a finishing touch of tobacco.

title: Château Roques Mauriac 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This lively, citrus-driven wine has tight acidity over bright grapefruit and lime, giving refreshing crispness. Immediately attractive, it offers an aftertaste that shines with lemon juice.

title: Damalisco 2014 Roble  (Toro)
description: Spicy oak aromas accent foxy red berry scents in this pinchy, wayward wine. Its chocolatey black fruit and peppery spice flavors finish jammy, with a lot of unresolved oak.

title: Château Calvimont 2016  Graves
description: This second label of Château de Cérons is lightly honeyed, even though bone dry. It has a soft, ripe texture with yellow fruits as well as a streak of good acidity. The perfumed Sauvignon Gris adds attractiveness. Drink from late 2017.

title: Château de Marsan 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Beautifully crisp and light, this is an ebullient wine that is full of lively red currant and tangerine fruits. There is attractive acidity, a bright aftertaste and plenty of acidity. Drink now.

title: Château Haut Mouleyre 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This delicious wine from old Sémillon vines offers a hint of nuts and spice as well as crisp, clean fruit. It is lively with acidity as well as having a richer side. The wine will be just right from the end of 2017.

title: Château Mission Saint Vincent 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This crisp, clean wine has both fruit and acidity in just the right proportions. With lively acidity and hint of herbal and citrus flavors, it is a fine apéritif style. The aftertaste continues this bright and lively character.

title: Château Pilet 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This wine is spicy, ripe and ready to drink. Ripe white stone fruits are laced with citrus acidity to give a lively wine with good fruit intensity. Drink this wine now for instant pleasure.

title: Cambria 2016 Rose of Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This salmon-hued bottling from Pinot Noir shows cantaloupe, watermelon Jolly Rancher and pink rose petal scents on the nose. The palate delivers bright acidity, presenting more watermelon flavors, a compelling texture and a gunmetal finish.

title: 14 Hands 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of barrel spice, toast, herb and plum are reticent on first pour. On the palate, sweet fruit flavors are supported by lightly grainy tannins. It's straight down the fairway.

title: Acquiesce 2016 Picpoul (Lodi)
description: Lean and graceful, this appealing wine from a Rhône grape variety blends fresh, appley aromas and crisp, dry jicama and pippin apple flavors with a firm and refreshing mouthfeel. It's light-bodied and well-balanced.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Premium Branco White (Alentejo)
description: This fine ripe wine is smooth and rich. Its acidity and apple-fruit aspect is balanced by richer yellow fruit and a touch of almonds. Drink this finely made wine now.

title: Adega Mãe 2015 Alvarinho (Lisboa)
description: This is a ripe take on the crisp Alvarinho. The wine does have acidity but it also has hints of rich tropical fruits. The texture is tangy while revealing a full-bodied, perfumed and vibrant wine. Drink now.

title: Baileyana 2016 Rose of Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: A brilliant shade of pink, this bottling shows all the classic rosé aromas, from watermelon, to strawberry to bubblegum, with a touch of warm pastry as well. The palate offers a candied watermelon and cotton candy flavors, without any sweetness.

title: Boeger 2015 Pinot Grande Pinot Noir (El Dorado)
description: Quite a bit lighter than the 2014 vintage, this wine layers buttery aromas over crisp apple and lemon flavors. It's pleasant and light in body, showing more richness than expected from its lively fruit components. Labeled as Pinot Noir, this is actually a white wine made from the dark grapes.

title: Boekenoogen 2015 Late Harvest Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: The point of this semisweet bottling is a little unclear, but it offers a beautifully rich nose of honeysuckle, buttercream, white peach, almond paste and flint. The palate is rich, creamy and quite sweet, with peach, melon and mango flavors. Consider it as a light dessert wine or a pairing for spicy foods.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2013 Reserve Sangiovese (Lake County)
description: Very smooth and mouthfilling, this medium-bodied wine has a harmonious feeling about it. Ripe, juicy fruit and cola flavors meet soft tannins, and a broad, expansive texture carries them into the finish.
